task.title: Rotate an Object in 3D
task.shortdesc: With the ROTATE command, you can rotate 2D objects. The rotation direction is determined by the current UCS. The ROTATE3D command is used to rotate objects in the 3D space.

context.p: With the use of ROTATE3D, you can define the rotation axis by specifying two points; X, Y, Z axis; or the Z direction of the current view. The 3D objects can be rotated with either the ROTATE command or ROTATE3D command.
To rotate an object about an axis in three dimensions

step.cmd: Select the objects to rotate, andthen press Enter.
Choose one from the following options: Object, Last, View, X-axis, Y-axis, Z-axis, 2points.

result.p: Select the objects to rotate (A), specify the endpoints of the axis of rotation (B and C), and then specify the r otation angle (D)
